revision.text:
On Juniper M-series routers, packet forwarding functionality was implemented on the so-called S-boards which typically hosted L3 lookup ASIC, service processor and glue logic. Since different M-series platforms had different functionality, this led to an array of S-board names:
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Platform ! Name ! Function ! |- | [[M40]] | [[SCB]] | L3 lookup | Originally shipped with [[Internet Processor]], later [[Internet Processor II]] |- | [[M20]] | [[SCB]] | L3 lookup | Extended M40 SCB design for "cold spare" redundancy of the forwarding plane |- | [[M160]] | [[SFM]] | L3 lookup | Allowed for OC192 support via packet spraying across four [[PFE]]s |- | [[M40e]] | [[SFM]] | L3 lookup | Utilizes M160-style packet distribution for [[PFE]] redundancy |- | [[M5]]/[[M10]] | [[FEB]] | L2&L3 lkp | Single board integrating all three ASICs of [[ABC chipset]] |- | [[M7i]]/[[M10i]] | [[cFEB]] | L2&L3 lkp | Single board featuring single integrated ABC ASIC |- | [[M120]] | [[FEB]] | L2&L3 lkp | Next-gen distributed M-series linecard based on [[I-chip]] |}
